item.title: "Pathetic, Never Happened In History": Ex-BCCI Selector Brutally Roasts Rohit Sharma - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Pathetic, Never Happened In History: Ex-BCCI Selector Brutally Roasts Rohit Sharma

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 Source: NDTV

Former BCCI chief selector MSK Prasad has sharply criticized Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma for his recent performances and captaincy, particularly following a series of disappointing results against New Zealand and low scores against Australia.

  • MSK Prasad comments on Rohit Sharma's low score of just three runs in the ongoing Test against Australia.
  • He labels India's recent loss to New Zealand as "pathetic," highlighting it as a historical low for Indian cricket.
  • Prasad notes Rohit's lack of proactivity as captain and suggests his recent failures have negatively impacted the team's performance.
  • During the ongoing Test, Australia's Steve Smith scored a century, contributing to a total of 474 runs.
  • India's bowling efforts were led by Jasprit Bumrah with 4 wickets.
“We had a three-match series against New Zealand, it was pathetic. It had never happened in the history of Indian cricket that we lost three games in a row.” - MSK Prasad

The critique by Prasad raises concerns about Rohit Sharma's current form and decision-making abilities as captain, which may influence India's performance in crucial matches ahead.

item.title: Sports Apparel Giant's Brutal Dig At Sanjay Manjrekar Over 'Can Reddy Score 100+?' Remark - NDTV Sports
item.description:
PUMA Takes a Jab at Sanjay Manjrekar After Reddy's Century

Date: December 28, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

India's Nitish Kumar Reddy proved his critics wrong by scoring his first Test century amid scrutiny from former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar, who questioned his spot on the team prior to the match.

  • Reddy achieved an unbeaten score of 105, contributing significantly to India's total of 385/9.
  • Manjrekar had previously expressed doubts about Reddy's abilities, suggesting he may not be viable as an all-rounder.
  • PUMA Cricket responded to Manjrekar's comments on social media, taking a dig at him using Reddy's recent performance.
  • The all-rounder's performance included 10 fours and a six, showcasing his batting prowess.
  • Reddy is under pressure as India continues to trail by 116 runs against Australia.
“It is too early to consider him as a batting all-rounder.” - Sanjay Manjrekar

PUMA's engagement highlights the ongoing narrative surrounding Reddy’s place in the team and the impact of social media reactions to players' performances.

item.title: FIDE chief urges fans to ask D Gukesh for the truth, attacks Magnus Carlsen in ‘we threatened players is a lie’ claim - Hindustan Times
item.description:
FIDE chief urges fans to ask D Gukesh for the truth, attacks Magnus Carlsen in ‘we threatened players is a lie’ claim

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The FIDE chief Emil Sutovsky has publicly refuted Magnus Carlsen's accusations that players involved in the Freestyle Chess Tour were threatened. The situation intensified after notable chess figures engaged in a public dispute over the events surrounding the tournament.

  • Vladimir Kramnik accused Magnus Carlsen of manipulating FIDE regarding the Freestyle Chess Players Club.
  • Sutovsky stated that the claims of players being threatened are false.
  • Carlsen faced removal from the ongoing championship due to attire violations.
  • The Freestyle Chess Grand Slam Tour 2025 is set to begin on January 4 with major participants including Carlsen and D Gukesh.
“The claim that FIDE threatened players who were willing to participate in Freestyle Chess Tour is a lie.” - Emil Sutovsky

This ongoing conflict reveals significant tensions within the chess community as players and governing bodies navigate competition regulations and claims of integrity.

item.title: ‘Magnus Carlsen was given enough time to change his jeans. We didn't ban him; could've played': FIDE CEO - Hindustan Times
item.description:
FIDE CEO Explains Magnus Carlsen's Disqualification Over Dress Code

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

FIDE CEO Emil Sutovski stated that Magnus Carlsen was given ample opportunity to change into formal attire before being disqualified from the World Rapid and Blitz Championship for wearing jeans, which violated tournament regulations.

  • Sutovski clarified that Carlsen was not banned but failed to comply with the dress code.
  • He noted that rules must apply to all participants and highlighted previous penalties for similar violations.
  • Carlsen expressed frustration with FIDE's dress code policies and decided to withdraw from the Blitz section of the tournament.
“I am pretty tired of FIDE, so I want no more of this. I don't want anything to do with them.” - Magnus Carlsen

The situation underscores the ongoing tension between tournament regulations and player preferences regarding dress codes in chess.

item.title: First Time In 147 Years: Nitish Kumar Reddy, Washington Sundar Hurt Australia Bad; Achieve Historic .. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
First Time In 147 Years: Nitish Kumar Reddy, Washington Sundar Hurt Australia Bad; Achieve Historic Record

Publication Date: December 28, 2024   Source: NDTV

Nitish Kumar Reddy achieved a remarkable maiden Test century at No. 8, supported by Washington Sundar, during the Boxing Day Test against Australia, marking a historic moment in cricket.

  • Nitish Kumar Reddy scored 105 runs off 176 balls, becoming the third youngest Indian to score a Test century in Australia.
  • Washington Sundar contributed with 50 runs, and together they built a crucial partnership of 127 runs.
  • This match marks the first instance in 147 years where both No. 8 and No. 9 batters faced over 150 balls each in a Test innings.
  • The emotional scene at the MCG included Reddy's father expressing joy and gratitude.
  • India ended Day 3 at 358/9, trailing Australia by 116 runs.
“This is a historic moment for Indian cricket, breaking a long-standing record and showcasing the depth of our batting.” - ESPN Cricinfo

The outstanding performance by Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar not only lifted India in a challenging match but also set a precedent for future cricket tournaments.

item.title: World rapid and blitz chess: After Carlsen disqualification, India's Arjun Erigaisi in joint lead - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Arjun Erigaisi Joins Leaders After Carlsen's Disqualification at World Chess Championship

Date: 28 December 2024, Source: New York

Indian grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi has emerged as one of the co-leaders in the ongoing World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championship following a day marked by the disqualification of five-time world champion Magnus Carlsen.

  • Arjun shares the lead with Volodar Murzin, Alexander Grischuk, and Duda Jan-Kryzstof, all on seven points after round 9.
  • Carlsen was fined $200 for wearing jeans, a violation of tournament dress code, and was disqualified after refusing to comply.
  • Arjun’s chances for victory improved significantly with Carlsen's withdrawal, as Carlsen was a major contender in faster formats.
  • In the women’s section, Koneru Humpy also leads with 6.5 points after winning four consecutive games.
  • Arjun defeated Robson Ray and Shant Sargsyan and drew with Murzin and Duda in his games.
“With Carlsen's withdrawal, Arjun's chances have increased dramatically as the Norwegian is known to win anything and everything that comes under the faster version.”

The championship continues with more rounds, and anticipation builds for the upcoming matches that will further shape the standings.

item.title: How Nitish Kumar Reddy countered Pat Cummins, Scott Boland and Nathan Lyon for an impressive maiden Test hundred - The Indian Express
item.description:
Nitish Kumar Reddy's Impressive Maiden Test Century Against Australia

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Nitish Kumar Reddy delivered a remarkable performance in his maiden Test match, scoring an impressive century against top Australian bowlers including Pat Cummins, Scott Boland, and Nathan Lyon.

  • Reddy showcased a balanced game, using both aggression and defense effectively.
  • He reached his fifty with an exuberant celebration referencing a popular Telugu film.
  • Reddy maintained composure against challenging deliveries from Cummins and Boland.
  • His strategy involved counter-attacks and well-calculated shots, which highlighted his batting IQ.
  • The match featured intense competition, particularly during Reddy's exchanges with Cummins.
  • Reddy's century was a personal milestone and a significant achievement for India in the Test series.
"Main jhukega naahi!" 🔥 - Nitish Kumar Reddy, celebrating his maiden Test fifty.

Reddy's performance not only marks his entry into the Test cricket arena but also has left a lasting impression on his supporters and the cricketing landscape.

item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Highlights: After Nitish Reddy's Historic 1st Ton, Early Stumps Taken Due To..

Publication Date: Not available | Source: NDTV Sports

The match showcased a historic milestone as Nitish Reddy achieved his first Test century, marking an exciting day in the series.

  • Nitish Reddy scored his first Test century, making a significant contribution to the team's performance.
  • Early stumps were taken due to unfavorable conditions, affecting the game's progression.
  • The match highlights the intense rivalry between India and Australia, with high expectations from both teams.
"Today was a proud moment for me, achieving my first Test ton against a strong team like Australia." - Nitish Reddy

This match is crucial for both teams in terms of rankings and confidence going forward in the series.

item.description:
BBL 2024-2025: Match 14, STA vs THU Match Prediction

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: CricTracker

The Big Bash League heats up as Melbourne Stars face off against Sydney Thunder in Match 14. The Stars are struggling, having lost all four matches, while the Thunder look to build on their mixed results.

  • Melbourne Stars (STA) have lost all four matches so far.
  • Sydney Thunder (THU) have won 1 out of 2 matches.
  • Match scheduled at Manuka Oval in Canberra.
  • Pitch is expected to favor batters, with high-scoring games likely.

“Sydney Thunder to win the match”

The matchup is pivotal for both teams, with STA looking for a turnaround and THU eager to secure their second victory.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy Surpasses India Great To Achieve Big Feat, India Solid vs Australia - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Score Updates: Nitish Reddy Hits Maiden Ton, Father Receives Warm Wishes From Crowd

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Nitish Kumar Reddy has brought up his maiden Test century for India, playing a crucial role with aggressive batting. Despite losing Jasprit Bumrah, India is positioned comfortably, aiming to overcome Australia’s score.

  • Nitish Reddy scored his maiden Test century.
  • India is aiming to surpass Australia's first innings total.
  • India has avoided follow-on with four wickets remaining.
  • Reddy is the first Indian at No 8 to breach the 90-run mark in Australia.
  • Washington Sundar also contributed significantly with 50 runs.
CENTURY!!! Nitish Kumar Reddy takes a boundary and completes his maiden century.

This pivotal performance showcases Reddy's potential and crucial contribution to India's innings, keeping their hopes alive in the 4th Test.

item.title: 'Stupid, stupid, stupid' - Gavaskar criticises Pant's shot selection - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
'Stupid, stupid, stupid' - Gavaskar criticises Pant's shot selection

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Pant’s shot selection during the match drew sharp criticism from Gavaskar after he lost his wicket trying an unorthodox shot, which was deemed reckless given the game situation.

  • Pant was batting fluently but attempted a risky scoop shot leading to an easy catch.
  • Gavaskar criticized the timing of Pant's shot, citing fielders in strategic positions.
  • Gavaskar expressed disappointment, stating that Pant let the team down with his reckless approach.
  • The former cricketer suggested that if Pant continues to play this way, he might need to bat lower in the order.
“Stupid, stupid, stupid,” was Gavaskar's immediate reaction. “That is letting your team down badly!”

This incident raises questions about Pant's shot selection at critical moments, emphasizing the need for better judgment in Test cricket.

item.title: Magnus Carlsen disqualified from top chess meet for violating dress code - The Hindu
item.description:
Magnus Carlsen Disqualified from Chess Championship for Dress Code Violation

Published on: December 28, 2024 10:41 am IST | Source: The Hindu

Five-time world champion Magnus Carlsen faced disqualification from the World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championship for wearing jeans, a violation of FIDE's dress code.

  • Carlsen was fined $200 for wearing jeans, which are prohibited under tournament regulations.
  • The chief arbiter, Alex Holowczak, requested Carlsen to change his attire, but he refused.
  • FIDE stated that the dress code rules are communicated to all participants in advance.
  • Russian Grandmaster Ian Nepomniachtchi was penalized for a similar violation but complied with the dress code.
“I am pretty tired of FIDE, so I want no more of this. I don't want anything to do with them.” — Magnus Carlsen

In the end, Carlsen expressed frustration with FIDE’s policies and decided to withdraw from the Blitz section of the championship.

item.title: 'No official complaint from India for Virat Kohli heckling' - says Melbourne Cricket Club CEO - The Times of India
item.description:
No official complaint from India for Virat Kohli heckling, says Melbourne Cricket Club CEO

Publication Date: Not available Source: Times of India

The Melbourne Cricket Club CEO confirmed that the Indian cricket team has not lodged any official complaint regarding heckling directed at Virat Kohli during the fourth Test match.

  • Kohli faced heckling after a controversial moment involving a shoulder bump with Australian debutant Sam Konstas.
  • Despite the crowd's hostility, there has been no formal complaint from the Indian team.
  • CEO Stuart Fox expressed concern only if the heckling escalated to abusive behavior.
  • Kohli was escorted to the dressing room after allegedly responding to fans.
  • India is behind in the Test match, with Australia leading by 148 runs.
“You’re never comfortable when you’ve got fans heavily engaging with the player.” - Stuart Fox

In conclusion, while there were some tensions in the crowd during the match, the lack of an official complaint indicates that the Indian team is taking the situation in stride.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy On Cusp Of Historic Record As Match Resumes After Rain - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Score Updates: Nitish Reddy On Cusp Of Historic Record As Match Resumes After Rain

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: NDTV

Nitish Kumar Reddy is on the verge of his maiden Test century, playing aggressively for India. With a crucial partnership alongside Washington Sundar, India aims to surpass Australia’s score and avoid the follow-on.

  • Reddy is currently unbeaten at 85, needing just two runs for a record at No. 8 against Australia.
  • Washington Sundar is nearing a half-century as well.
  • India has avoided follow-on, now looking to surpass Australia’s first innings score.
  • After rain interruptions, the match is set to resume, which has excited fans.
“AND INDIA HAVE DONE IT!!!! The partnership between Nitish Reddy and Washington Sundar has helped the visitors escape the follow-on.”

As the match progresses, Reddy's performance could lead to significant achievements for the Indian team.

item.title: World rapid & blitz: Carlsen walks out of tournament after dress code breach - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Carlsen Exits Rapid & Blitz Tournament Over Dress Code Violation

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen walked out of the World Rapid and Blitz Tournament in New York after he refused to comply with dress code regulations. After being fined for wearing jeans, Carlsen opted to leave the tournament instead of changing his attire.

  • Carlsen was fined $200 for wearing jeans, which are prohibited by FIDE regulations.
  • He was not paired for round nine after refusing to change his clothes.
  • Carlsen expressed his frustration, stating it became a matter of principle for him.
  • Another player, Ian Nepomniachtchi, complied with the dress code after being fined.
“Honestly, I’m too old at this point to care too much... Probably I’ll head off to somewhere where the weather is a bit nicer than here.” - Magnus Carlsen

Carlsen's exit has raised eyebrows in the chess community, emphasizing ongoing tensions between players and FIDE regarding regulations and player rights.

item.title: 'Virat Would Have...': Sunil Gavaskar Opens Up On Yashasvi Jaiswal-Kohli Mix-Up - OneCricket
item.description:
'Virat Would Have...': Sunil Gavaskar Opens Up On Yashasvi Jaiswal-Kohli Mix-Up

Publication Date: Not provided

Source: Not provided

After a dramatic mix-up leading to Yashasvi Jaiswal's run out during the fourth Test against Australia, cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar weighs in on the incident, highlighting the miscommunication between Jaiswal and Virat Kohli.

  • India was in a challenging position after early wickets, but Jaiswal and Kohli formed a 100-run partnership.
  • Jaiswal was run out for 82 due to a miscommunication with Kohli.
  • Gavaskar believes Kohli should have reacted quicker to Jaiswal's call.
  • He also suggests that the run taken was risky and unnecessary given the context of the match.
  • India has since regained control on Day 3, with key performances from Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar.
“It could have been a quick single, and someone like Virat Kohli would likely have made it. However, the issue was that he glanced at the fielder. When you do that, you lose that crucial second.” - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, while Gavaskar criticized the mix-up, he acknowledged Kohli's running abilities and the unnecessary risk taken during the run.

item.title: "Could Have Got Him Out 6-7 Times In 2 Overs": Jasprit Bumrah's Blunt Take On Sam Konstas With Whom .. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Reflects on Challenging Clash with Sam Konstas During Fourth Test

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

In a recent Test match against Australia, Jasprit Bumrah discussed his experience facing debutant Sam Konstas, expressing confidence in his abilities despite Konstas's impressive performance.

  • Bumrah felt he could have dismissed Konstas several times in the early overs.
  • Konstas played aggressively, scoring 60 runs with two sixes off Bumrah.
  • This marked the first time in three years Bumrah was scored against with a six in Test cricket.
  • Bumrah reflected on the unpredictable nature of cricket, emphasizing that performance can vary from day to day.
  • He praised the challenges of playing in Australia, highlighting the testing conditions for bowlers.
  • Bumrah acknowledged the talent of Australian batsman Steve Smith, describing him as a challenging opponent.
Bumrah stated, "Initially I felt I could have got him out 6-7 times in the first two overs but that's how cricket goes. Some days it pays off, some days it doesn't."

Overall, Bumrah's insights shed light on the dynamics of international cricket, particularly in high-pressure situations against young talents like Konstas.

item.title: "Time to drop Rohit Sharma": Ex-cricketers and Harsha Bhogle opine on batter's place in Test squad - Crictoday
item.description:
Time to drop Rohit Sharma: Ex-cricketers and Harsha Bhogle opine on batter’s place in Test squad

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Crictoday

Rohit Sharma's continued struggles in Test cricket prompt discussions among former cricketers and commentators about his future in the national team.

  • Rohit Sharma is facing increased pressure due to his poor performance impacting team dynamics.
  • Ajit Agarkar, chief selector, has reportedly communicated with him regarding his place in the squad.
  • If India loses the Test series, there may be an announcement of his retirement.
  • Experts like Harsha Bhogle, Mark Waugh, and Michael Vaughan express their concerns about Rohit's form and age.
“Rohit Sharma is clearly struggling. You need performance from your skipper but Rohit is out-of-form,” - Mark Waugh

The situation raises questions about leadership roles and the impact of individual performance on team success.

item.title: 'Put My Life And Last Dollar On Virat': Australia Great Picks Kohli Over Sachin Tendulkar And Brian Lara - News18
item.description:
Put My Life And Last Dollar On Virat

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: News18

Australian cricket legend Justin Langer has expressed his unwavering faith in Virat Kohli, stating he would bet his life and last dollar on him as the best player, even over greats like Sachin Tendulkar and Brian Lara.

  • Kohli is recognized as one of the finest batters despite facing a lean period in form.
  • In the ongoing Test series against Australia, Kohli began with a strong performance but faced challenges in subsequent innings.
  • Langer praised Kohli’s discipline, impressive skill set, and leadership qualities during commentary.
  • He acknowledged the privilege of playing against cricket legends while highlighting Kohli’s exceptional attributes.
“If I had my life and my last dollar, I would have Virat Kohli batting for me.” - Justin Langer

Langer emphasized that Kohli's combination of technique, fitness, and leadership makes him stand out among cricketing legends.

item.title: 'Flower Nahi, Fire Hai': BCCI's Tweet For Nitish Kumar Reddy Goes Viral - News18
item.description:
'Flower Nahi, Fire Hai': BCCI's Viral Tweet Celebrates Nitish Kumar Reddy's Maiden Test Fifty

Last Updated: December 28, 2024, 14:57 IST | Source: News18

Nitish Kumar Reddy, a young cricketer from Andhra Pradesh, made headlines after scoring his maiden Test fifty in the Boxing Day Test against Australia, aided by an iconic celebration and a viral BCCI tweet.

  • Nitish Kumar Reddy scored his maiden Test fifty during the ongoing 4th Test at Melbourne Cricket Ground.
  • BCCI's tweet featured the phrase ‘Flower nahi, fire hai’, referencing a popular movie dialogue.
  • Reddy scored 50 runs from 81 balls, helping India avoid follow-on.
  • The tweet and celebration received widespread appreciation from fans and cricket experts alike.
“Haven’t been too many batters across both teams who’ve looked more accomplished than Nitish Kumar Reddy in this series. Surely earned the right to bat No 5.” — Bharat Sundaresan

Nitish’s performance not only brought him praise but also sparked excitement among fans as he rose to prominence in the cricketing world.

item.title: "Stupid, Go Back To...": Sunil Gavaskar Livid With Rishabh Pant. Reason For Rant Is... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Stupid, Go Back To...": Sunil Gavaskar Livid With Rishabh Pant

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: ABC Sport

Much was expected from Rishabh Pant during the third day of the fourth Test against Australia, but he delivered a careless dismissal, prompting a viral rant from Sunil Gavaskar.

  • Rishabh Pant struggled with his shot selection, particularly a risky lap pull that resulted in his dismissal.
  • The MCG pitch was in favorable condition for batting, and Pant's innings was seen as a missed opportunity.
  • Gavaskar criticized Pant's decision, stating he was letting the team down and that his shot was unsuitable for the situation.
  • Despite Pant's dismissal, India managed to score over 300, bolstered by contributions from Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar.
"Stupid! Stupid! Stupid! You've got two fielder there and you still go for that. That is throwing away your wicket. Not in the situation that India was... He should be going into the other dressing room," remarked Sunil Gavaskar.

Gavaskar's comments highlight the need for players to adapt their game according to the match situation, especially in critical moments.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy, Washington Sundar Stitch Historic Partnership As India Go Past 300 - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: No Resumption Time Out As Drizzle Continues In Melbourne

Publication Date: Today | Source: NDTV

The ongoing rain in Melbourne has delayed the resumption of play on Day 3 of the 4th Test match between India and Australia.

  • Ongoing drizzle has led to uncertainty regarding the resumption of the match.
  • No announcements have been made about a potential restart time.
  • Fans eagerly await updates as the weather conditions are being monitored closely.
“The match has been subjected to numerous weather-related delays today.”

As the weather remains unpredictable, spectators and players alike are hoping for a break in the rain to allow the game to continue.

item.title: Watch: Nitish Reddy's 'Pushpa' celebration on reaching maiden Test fifty - The Times of India
item.description:
Nitish Reddy Celebrates Maiden Test Fifty with 'Pushpa' Dance

Publication Date: Recent; Source: Times of India

Nitish Kumar Reddy has impressed in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series and achieved his first Test fifty during the fourth Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Reddy debuted in the Perth Test and had notable scores throughout the series.
  • He scored his maiden Test fifty, helping India surpass the follow-on mark.
  • Celebrated his fifty with the 'Thaggede le' dance from the movie 'Pushpa', entertaining fans and players alike.
“His celebration evoked laughter and admiration from legends in the game.”

This performance marks a significant milestone in Reddy's career, showcasing his potential on the international stage.
